Simplified Meaning: Avg. domain axioms per class (defines how well properties are linked to classes)
Avg. annotations per class (shows richness of metadata)
Avg. superclasses per non-root class (measures coupling/dependency)
Avg. instances per class (shows how populated each class is)
Max depth from root to leaf class (hierarchy depth)
Avg. object properties per class (relationship richness)
Avg. ancestor classes per leaf (inheritance depth)
Avg. child classes per class (hierarchical spread)
Avg. number of properties per class (functional richness)
Lack of cohesion (measures how scattered the connections are)
Avg. usage of properties per class (interaction level)
Ratio of relationships to total axioms (expressiveness of links)
Avg. number of superclasses per class (multi-inheritance level)
Avg. datatype/object properties and subclasses per class (schema richness)
Linkable elements based on domain axioms (connectivity potential)
